shortlist.name: Gamrai
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a promising debut (3rd) to win last time out, showing clear progression and professionalism. Trained by the top Gosden team and ridden by leading jockey Oisin Murphy, both of whom have excellent records at this level. The odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest minimal improvement is needed to win again.

shortlist.name: Alcarath (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Showed ability with a close 4th on debut and improved to finish 2nd last time, indicating upward trajectory. Rossa Ryan is a capable jockey and Alan King’s runners often progress with experience. The odds are fair for an each-way or place angle, but he may need Gamrai to underperform to win.

Baffert's runners are typically well-prepared for their debuts or early starts, and Hernandez is a leading rider at this venue. In the absence of published form, the connections and likely market support make this runner a strong contender.

The Baffert/Fresu partnership has produced winners at Santa Anita, and the stable often runs multiple strong chances in the same race. Market support is anticipated.

shortlist.rationale: Solid and consistent form, including a recent win and several close finishes. Muzi Yeni is a top jockey in South Africa, and the stable is in good order. Horse is holding form and does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Azaleas For All (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and two placings in last five starts, showing competitiveness and reliability. Connections are strong and the horse is proven at this level. No major negatives in the profile.

shortlist.name: Top Division (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.24 exchange odds.
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a win and placed efforts, trained by a top local yard, and ridden by a reliable jockey. The odds reflect high confidence from the market and connections.

shortlist.name: Stormy Day (Arg)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut winner, representing the same leading trainer as the favorite. Jockey is experienced and the horse is unexposed, offering value if improving again.

shortlist.name: Alpha World (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.54, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and consistent form figures. Trained by a leading yard and partnered by a top jockey. Recent win suggests further improvement is likely, and current odds reflect strong confidence.

shortlist.name: Got The Feeling (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.54, well-fancied in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and unbeaten in two of three starts, including a win last time. Shows clear ability and scope for further progress. Connections are in good form and the horse is unexposed compared to rivals.

shortlist.name: The Last Duke (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.54, among the market leaders.
shortlist.rationale: Rapid improvement in recent starts, winning two back and runner-up last time. Consistent and appears to be on an upward curve. Trainer and jockey have solid local records.

shortlist.name: Destiny Of Fire (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form, trained by top connections (de Kock), and supported by strong market confidence. No signs of decline in form and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Accept Cookies (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid odds at 1.54 exchange, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins in last four starts, reliable jockey, and trainer in good standing. Profile suggests ongoing improvement and ability to compete at this level.

shortlist.name: Palace Dancer (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Regularly placed and competitive in recent runs, with a win and multiple seconds. Connections are respected and form is steady, indicating readiness for another big run.

shortlist.name: Chieftain's Shield (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.54, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three consecutive wins and consistent placings prior. Connections have kept the horse at a competitive level, and the recent form suggests reliability and readiness for another strong performance.

shortlist.name: Clarkson (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.54, well-backed in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and a second, showing improvement and ability to compete at this level. Jockey and trainer have a solid local record, and the horse is proven over the course and distance.

shortlist.name: Super Awesome (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown versatility and placed consistently, including a win and several top-four finishes. Connections are reliable, and the horse’s form profile suggests it is competitive and fit.

shortlist.name: Take Charge Tom (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders based on trainer/jockey combo and typical market behavior for this profile.
shortlist.rationale: Robertino Diodoro is a high-percentage trainer at Remington Park and often targets these races with well-prepared runners. Ramon Vazquez is a top jockey at this venue, and their partnership is notably successful. Even without published form, the connections and likely market support make this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Iron Dome (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be well-fancied due to top connections and typical market support for Asmussen runners.
shortlist.rationale: Steven Asmussen is one of the leading trainers in the US, and Jose Ortiz is a top-tier jockey. Horses from this barn are usually well-prepared for their debuts or early starts at Remington. The combination of elite connections and probable market respect puts this horse firmly on the shortlist.

shortlist.name: Bracket Buster (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be single-figure odds given the presence of Luis Saez and a capable trainer.
shortlist.rationale: Luis Saez is a leading US jockey and rarely travels without a live chance. Victoria Oliver is a respected trainer, and this combination suggests the horse is expected to be competitive. Market support is likely, and the connections alone justify inclusion.
